MEMORANDUM BY THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR DOMINION AFFAIRS. - WITH reference to the Memorandum on the above subject circulated asCP. 304 (28), I circulate to my colleagues a copy of the reply which I have receivedfrom the Irish Free State Minister for External Affairs to my letter of the 12th Octoberregarding the proposed appointment of Free State Ministers at Paris and Berlin. Dominions Office, Downing Street, S.W. 1, L. S. A. October 27, 1928.(E.A. 3/1928.) Department of External Affairs,Dear Mr. Amery, ' Irish Free State, October 19, 1928. I have received your letter of the 12th instant regarding the proposed appointmentof Irish Ministers at Paris and Berlin, and I am glad to hear that the preliminaryinquiries are being made. I am very sorry that Sir Austen Chamberlain has been ill, and I trust he will onhis return be restored to good health. In the circumstances we shall not expect a reply until he has been consulted. You will, I am sure, take the first opportunity afterSir Austen Chamberlain's arrival in London to have the matter discussed and to favourus with your observations. I shall with pleasure send you the text of any replies we may receive from Canada,South Africa and Australia. Yours sincerely, (Signed) P. McGILLIGAN. L. S. Arnery, Esq.[18370]
